Data: 26.3;4;Kallis to Clarke, FOUR runs the outswinger is over-cooked, Kallis sends down an amiable full toss outside off and Clarke shows exemplary footwork and wrists as he eases it into the covers.;
Tahir to Clarke, no run whippy ball straightens and slides down straight on middle and off, Clarke forces the cut into the off side.
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run more width this time, he cuts it away square for a single.
Tahir to Marsh, no run tossed up outside off, Marsh leans out and defends into the off side.
Tahir to Marsh, no run nice variation in length, Marsh was trying to get forward and then realised he wasn't going to get there. Adjusts and defends to the off side.
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run fuller now, he leans well forward and drives to mid-off for a single.
Tahir to Clarke, no run Clarke leans out to the ball flighted outside off and defends to the off side.
Philander to Marsh, no run angles the first ball across Marsh from over the stumps, and he leaves it to the keeper.

Philander to Marsh, no run appeal for an lbw, it is turned down and South Africa review again. That was sent down from over the stumps, and it hit his front pad - a foot in front of the crease - in front of leg and middle, as Marsh tries to flick it away. But the operative part
Philander to Marsh, no run wasted ball down the leg side, Marsh can't get the glance away, it is too wide.
Philander to Marsh, no run deviates sharply away from the left hander after landing full outside off, Marsh doesn't bother with it.
Philander to Marsh, no run angled across once again, Marsh watches the seam movement closely and leaves.
Philander to Marsh, 2 runs back of a length at 133 kph, Marsh tucks it around the corner for a couple more. South Africa's attack seem to be losing steam now.
Tahir to Clarke, no run tossed up outside off, driven with the turn into the off side.

Tahir to Clarke, FOUR runs Clarke's gone to 50, and I swear I had no idea he had got that many. This is a really good innings, consdering he was being owned by Steyn at the start of it. Tahir sends down a gentle full toss on the pads as Pup advances, and whips it away through m
Tahir to Clarke, no run another full toss, driven strongly into the covers where a diving save from AB comes in the way. He's already nursing a sore finger, and that troubled it some more.
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run another fullish ball outside off, Clarke gets the single into the covers.
Tahir to Marsh, no run tossed up and straightening into Marsh from outside off and he defends.
Tahir to Marsh, no run that held its line as it went across Marsh, who defended to the off side.
Philander to Clarke, no run short of a length outside off, Clarke lets it go as he stays on the crease.

Philander to Clarke, no run a ripper amidst a lot of ordinary bowling. Vernon goes closer to an acceptable length for a change, Clarke tries to get forward but is yards short of it as it lands and zips away off the seam, play and a miss of epic proportions.
Philander to Clarke, no run covers the line better this time and defends down the line.
Philander to Clarke, 1 run angled into the pads, Clarke is inside the line and helps it along to fine leg for a single.
Philander to Marsh, no run back of a length around middle and off, Marsh stays on the back foot as he covers the line and defends to the off side.
Philander to Marsh, no run 129 kph and a fuller length outside off, Marsh defends compactly into the off side.
Tahir to Clarke, 2 runs Is Clarke the best player of spin in this side? Almost inevitably, he shimmies out of the crease, gets to the pitch and laces Tahir into the covers for a couple.
Tahir to Clarke, FOUR runs inexperience showing. Tahir sends down an amiable full toss, Clarke says thank you and butchers it with a slog-heave over midwicket. He'll be sad he didn't get six for it.
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run skips out again, punches down to mid-on for a single.
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run tossed up to Marsh, he drives smoothly past wide mid-on for another single.
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run tossed up wide of off stump, Clarke leans out with an opened face and guides it square for a single.
Tahir to Marsh, no run another full toss, outside off stump, and Marsh swings it to Smith at mid-on.
Philander to Clarke, no run that's the length he needs to maintain. Full, outside off, drawing Clarke forward into a check-drive into the covers.
Philander to Clarke, no run this one wobbles away from a length outside off, Clarke shoulders arms now.

Philander to Clarke, no run beaten by an indipper. Vernon's biggest strength is the ability to get the wobble going either way, that one cut in sharply from a length and stayed low too. Clarke was back on the crease and loose in defence, the ball cut through him and just missed
Philander to Clarke, (no ball) 1 run over-steps and drifts onto the pads now, Clarke helps it away to the leg side for one.
Philander to Marsh, no run now he bends one into the left-hander cutting him into two, almost. Clarke manages to keep it out though, as he's caught on the crease.

Philander to Marsh, FOUR runs what a peach of a pick-up whip through midwicket. Half-volley on the pads alright, but Marsh's movement was a treat to watch there as he got the front foot into line and dispatched it with a decisive jab of the wrists.
Philander to Marsh, no run back of a length outside off, Marsh stays back and defends backward of point.
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run over-pitched on the stumps, Clarke drives it back past Tahir who fumbles to allow the single.
Tahir to Marsh, no run flighted on the pads, worked softly to the leg side.
Tahir to Marsh, no run tossed up outside off now, Marsh plays it back to the bowler.

Tahir to Marsh, FOUR runs flighted too far outside off, Tahir is looking completely harmless here. Marsh shows him the way to the extra cover boundary with a lovely reach across and a gentle swish of the bat.
Tahir to Marsh, FOUR runs even more decisively this time. Marsh gets more width outside off, and leans out and whacks it away into the covers. This spell must be coming to an end.
Tahir to Marsh, no run googly tossed up outside off, driven off the front foot back to the bowler.
Philander to Clarke, FOUR runs Australia are slowly taking control here. Vernon nips one back into Clarke from too short of a length, and Pup hops to nudge it away behind square for four more.
Philander to Clarke, no run back of a length and a much better line, Clarke gets behind it and plays it back to the bowler.

Philander to Clarke, FOUR runs over-pitched now at an amiable 131 kph on the pads. Food, drink, dessert and some other assorted goodies for someone with Clarke's wrosts as he stays on the crease and swooshes it away through midwicket.
Philander to Clarke, no run finally finds the channel outside off, and Clarke shoulders arms duly.
Philander to Clarke, no run short of a length outside off, Clarke doesn't have a go at it as it bustles away harmlessly to the keeper.

Philander to Clarke, FOUR runs Vernon seams this away, but it is far too short outside off to trouble Clarke. He stays back, reads it off the track, stays on top of the bounce and guides it expertly through point for another four. SA are haemorhaging now as the stand is worth o
Tahir to Marsh, no run tossed up outside off, Marsh ensures it doesn't break in and defends off the front foot.
Tahir to Marsh, no run he's forward again and blocks off the front foot.
Tahir to Marsh, no run tossed up on off stump, defended off the front foot.
Tahir to Marsh, no run Marsh covers the line as he presses forward, and defends again.
Tahir to Marsh, no run a touch of drift away from Marsh, very full ball and he digs it back to the leg side.
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run Marsh chips out now, gets close to the flight and whips a single to midwicket.

Steyn to Marsh, OUT It's taken him one ball to make a difference! Marsh's been ruled lbw, and he's being very optimistic reviewing that. Good old patent indipper, lands at pace on a length around off stump and nips in, Marsh has been solid all day, but this time he doesn't get

Steyn to Hussey, no run Aha! 143 kph, hits the gloves with a bombshell that darts back in from short of a length. Hussey tries to fend it away the way the late Frasier would have tried to keep Ali's jabs away. The bottom hand is off, the top hand takes a rap and the ball goes t
Steyn to Hussey, no run better from the Huss, gets behind the line this time.
Steyn to Hussey, no run that's gone away, that's absolutely exploded from a short length, Hussey ducks for dear life, and Bouch's gloves take a pounding.
Steyn to Hussey, no run 145 kph, on the hips, Hussey shuffles into the line and deflects it to the leg side.

Steyn to Hussey, no run length ball on middle and leg at 144 kph, what a sensational over. Hussey nudges it to the leg side. A huge breach before tea, but Hussey has done well to ensure one wicket didn't lead to another.
Morkel to Clarke, no run short and wide at 140 kph, it has been a bit of a malaise today, this length. Easy leave outside off.
Morkel to Clarke, no run again, short and miles wide of off stump, Clarke lets it go through to the keeper.
Morkel to Clarke, 4 byes aha, Morne again sends this wide of off stump, it then seams away and dies on Bouch who is miffed as it runs away for byes.
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run too short, too wide at 142 kph, and Clarke cuts it away square for a single.
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run short of a length, easy line on the pads at 142 kph and Hussey turns it round the corner for a single.
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run too short, too wide, Clarke leans across and hacks it square for another single.
Steyn to Clarke, 2 runs starts with a full ball outside off that goes away, Clarke starts with a positive push forward and across, and a chirpy drive into the covers.
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run full and wide outside off, Clarke takes him on with an uppish square drive. A dodgy shot for just a single, since deep point is in place.
Steyn to Hussey, no run too full, too wide, Hussey can't reach it if he wants to.
Steyn to Hussey, no run short of a length outside off, Hussey sees it through to the keeper.
Steyn to Hussey, no run fuller length on and outside off stump, pushed into the covers off the front foot.
Steyn to Hussey, no run on the pads to end the over, Hussey turns it away with the wrists to square leg. Not the most fiery Steyn over we have seen today.
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run too short and too wide, Clarke reaches across and cuts to the deep for a single.
Morkel to Hussey, no run angled in from wide of the crease, Hussey stays back and nudges off the pads to square leg.
Morkel to Hussey, no run big bounce outside off, Hussey watches the rise and stands tall and shoulders arms to keep the bat out of the way.
Morkel to Hussey, no run pegs him back with another short ball, Hussey covers the line and defends.

Morkel to Hussey, no run a Morne special that. Comes in from wide of the stumps, lands outside off and straightens subtly enough to beat Hussey as he defends down the straight line. It misses the edge too, and hits the thigh. Jaffa.
Morkel to Hussey, no run ends the over with a steep bouncer, Hussey tries to get under it and clout the pull away, but it is through him in a big hurry.

Steyn to Clarke, FOUR runs boy, Clarke is seeing the ball like a boulder rolling down the Table Mountain. Short and wide from Steyn at 144 kph, Clarke absolutely climbs on it and pulverises the ball with a cut shot that sends the ball speeding away on the double.
Steyn to Clarke, no run fuller now, Clarke's not close to it, but still drives competently, but straight to mid-off.
Steyn to Clarke, no run full length on 137 kph, driven off the front foot to mid-off.
Steyn to Clarke, no run back of a length outside off at 140 kph, Clarke stays back and rises on the toes to let it go.
Steyn to Clarke, no run short ball once more, steep climb outside off and Clarke keeps the bat well below the firing line.
Steyn to Clarke, no run finishes with the full ball, Clarke takes the bait but doesn't fall for it. He leans out and drives into the covers.
Morkel to Hussey, no run back of a length from round the stumps, defended to the off side from the crease.
Morkel to Hussey, no run huge indipper, Morne gets this going from well wide of off stump, and Hussey ends up having to really tuck his tummy in and stay back as it keeps coming in.

Morkel to Hussey, OUT and another, Hussey is gone off the inside edge. Morne's getting the ball to whistle in sharply now, and it is too good for Mr Cricket. He let the previous one go, but knew it came disconcertingly close to off stump. This time he tries to stay put on the c
Morkel to Haddin, no run short and pacy outside off, climbing away steeply outside off, Haddin lets it go.

Morkel to Haddin, FOUR runs what a hoick to get going. Short and wide outside off, Haddin smashes it away with cartoonish impetuosity. He stands tall, lifts one foot in the air and launches this towards third man.
Morkel to Haddin, 1 run gets a single to end the over, which means he faces Steyn now.
Steyn to Haddin, no run 144 kph, short of a length, buzzing away from wide of off stump. Haddin stays rooted at the crease and swishes wildly at it, but it is through him.

Steyn to Haddin, no run Haddin is absolutely #pwned by this one, and he knows he just wasn't good enough to nick it. Pacy, on the perfect length around middle and off and then zipping away like an inebriated college student. Haddin wasn't forward, and tried driving down the lin
Steyn to Haddin, no run tries the dream ball that zips away from leg stump, but sprays it down the leg side.
Steyn to Haddin, no run he's caught on the crease again, gets across but not forward as he tries to cover the line. Too good, this, from Steyn.

Steyn to Haddin, OUT ah well, Aus are in big trouble now. Haddin's gone, not learning the lesson from the previous two balls. Stays on the crease again as Steyn gets fuller and closer to off stump to ensure Haddin doesn't play and miss this time. Haddin obliges, gets across and
Steyn to Johnson, no run full and fast angled across Mitch, who gets across but shoulders arms.
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run Morne attacks the stumps from over the stumps, Clarke works it square for a single.
Morkel to Johnson, no run covers the line as Morne keeps it on a length, and defends with full face to the off side.
Morkel to Johnson, no run short of a length outside off, defended from the crease.
Morkel to Johnson, 2 runs bouncer, Mitch wants to pull but it climbs extra on him and he's aeons late on the shot and heaves it ungainly in front of square.

Morkel to Johnson, no run that's page 1 from 'How not to play the bouncer for dummies'. Mitch stays rooted, doesn't duck, takes his eyes off the ball, holds the bat in front of his face and fends in hope. He manages to keep it down somehow.
Morkel to Johnson, FOUR runs well done Mitch, he knew this was going to be full. He stayed on the crease, but was crouching low to pounce on the half-volley and flick it furiously through midwicket.
Steyn to Clarke, 2 runs full ball on off stump and swerving away, Clarke drives into the covers. Not well timed, but that's positive footwork for you.
Steyn to Clarke, no run goes to leg stump and looks to square him up, it straightens down the line and Clarke works it cautiously to the leg side.

Steyn to Clarke, 2 runs full and wide of off stump, Clarke drives away from the body, but it doesn't seem to matter anymore, since he's middling almost everything. Amla trots across from deep point to cut off the boundary.
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run short ball, misdirected onto the hips and Clarke glances it in pleasing fashion down to fine leg.
Steyn to Johnson, 1 leg bye back of a length, nudged off the hips down to fine leg.
Steyn to Clarke, 2 runs looks to york him, finishes a half volley at 134 kph on the toes and Clarke twinkles it away through midwicket for a couple.
Morkel to Johnson, no run buzzes in back of a length from over the stumps, it takes off from there the way it does when Morne bowls, and Mitch stays out of the way.
Morkel to Johnson, no run stays on the crease this time and plays with the angle to the leg side.

Morkel to Johnson, 2 runs smashes the pull away, absolute swat that as a 142 kph bumper came along. Somehow, it wasn't timed as well as it seemed he would have with such a sumptuous swing. Still worth a couple.
Morkel to Johnson, no run Morne goes wider of off stump, Mitch leans out and shoulders arms.

Morkel to Johnson, FOUR runs Mitch is looking super dangerous here from SA"s point of view. Full ball, wide of off stump, inviting the poke or the push, but what does Mitch give it? The kitchen sink. He doesn't try getting close to the line, he just lashes at it and the ball ta
Morkel to Johnson, 2 runs length delivery on middle and leg, Mitch flicks with hard hands, a touch uppish, but he finds the gap and gets a couple through midwicket.
Kallis to Clarke, no run length ball seaming away as is Kallis' wont, Clarke lets it go.
Kallis to Clarke, no run goes wider of off stump now, Clarke isn't sucked into playing at it.

Kallis to Clarke, no run 126 kph, nips this one in off a length, and there's a huge lbw appeal as Clarke is hit on the pad Umpire Gould has been phenomenal so far today, and SA decide against reviewing his decision. Correct call too, Clarke was struck quite high as he moved int

Kallis to Clarke, FOUR runs a thing of beauty this, Clarke's flowing cover drive. Kallis goes back to the full away-swinger, Clarke leans out, gets close to the pitch and the hands then take over, just rolling through the line.
Kallis to Clarke, no run shorter length, wide of off stump and this time Clarke lets it go through.
Kallis to Clarke, no run finishes with a length ball on off stump, and it is punched confidently to wide mid-off.
Philander to Johnson, no run a bit of a loosener, angled across at a gentle pace, and Mitch defends from the crease.
Philander to Johnson, 2 runs don't pitch on the pads of Mitch. Else he'll swish it with a flick of the wrists. Just like that.
Philander to Johnson, no run short ball, Mitch spots the length early and ducks under it.
Philander to Johnson, 1 run shaped in off the seam and it ends on Mitch's pads again, this time he turns it more politely and finds square leg.

Philander to Clarke, no run appeal for lbw as Vernon jags one back into Clarke. Second time in recent times Clarke's been caught napping by an indipper, but height's saved him again. He was playing for the straight ball, but it kept coming in and hit him above the pad. Quite ad
Philander to Clarke, 1 run fuller length to end the over, Clarke drills it into the covers for a single.
Kallis to Clarke, 1 run short ball, Clarke gets inside the line and pulls it away square for a single. Takes him to 98.
Kallis to Johnson, no run heavy ball, landed well short and Mitch looks for the upper cut. Play and a miss.
Kallis to Johnson, 3 runs nice shot. Kallis pitches up at a friendly pace, and Mitch drills it into the covers for three.
Kallis to Clarke, no run short and wide of off stump, Clarke lets it go to the keeper.

Kallis to Clarke, FOUR runs what a corker of a shot to bring up a corker of a 100. Kallis tries to tempt him into edging a drive with a full ball outside off. The drive came, the edge didn't. Clarke veritably walks into the cover drive and almost inevitably finds the gap. He pu
Kallis to Clarke, no run short of a length outside off, Clarke lets it go through.
Philander to Johnson, no run short of a length on Mitch's middle and leg line, he looks for the whip again but can't get it away.
Philander to Johnson, no run

Philander to Johnson, OUT one shot too many, and that's the end of Mitch. South Africa will breathe a sigh of relief to see their tormentor back, but this may prove to be an invaluable 20. Short ball, angled across wide of off stump, and he tries to forehand it across to the le
Philander to Harris, 1 run Harris is away, stays back and drops a length ball into the point area and scurries to the other end.
Philander to Clarke, no run goes away off the seam from outside off, Clarke opens up his stance and defends to the off side.

Philander to Clarke, (no ball) fuller length, driven hard by Clarke but he can't beat mid-off. AB de Villiers puts in a big stretch and dives, and seems to have strained his back in the process. He has had back issues in the past ...
Philander to Clarke, 1 wide too short, and called a wide for height now. This over is taking longer than expected.

Philander to Clarke, FOUR runs uppish, but safe as houses. Clarke is into position for the drive so early, he slots it in the air to the leg side of the pitch, and Philander has no chance to grab it on his follow through. Clarke is looking invincible now.
Kallis to Harris, no run Kallis plugs away back of a length outside off, Harris doesn't take the bait this time.
Kallis to Harris, 2 runs a good old tail-ender's smear from Harris. Opens up the off side, flexes his muscles and just lofts it over the covers for a couple.
Kallis to Harris, no run Kallis goes wider of the stumps now, Harris doesn't have a poke at it.
Kallis to Harris, 2 runs another stand and deliver pick up over the covers from Harris, he ensures the ball hits the middle of the bat and clears the in-field.
Kallis to Harris, no run fuller and attacking the stumps, Harris stays in the crease and covers the line to defend down the track.
Kallis to Harris, no run Harris defends the last ball before drinks, gets behind the line and blocks to the off side.
Philander to Clarke, no run short of a length on off stump, Clarke covers the line and defends solidly.
Philander to Clarke, 1 run opens the face of the bat as he stays on the crease and guides square. Gee, Vernon seems to have lost a few yards since the morning.
Philander to Harris, no run on Harris' pads at 131 kph, he skips inside the line and works it to square leg.
Philander to Harris, no run bouncer, Harris ducks early and gets out of danger.

Philander to Harris, OUT a typical tail-ender job from Harris, he's holed out to mid-on in comical fashion. Bouncer outside off, its heading for his face and he tries it swat it away as if it were a bothersome fly. He gets a top-edge and it goes high, and doesn't come very low
Philander to Siddle, no run full ball outside off, Siddle leans forward and defends square.
Steyn to Clarke, no run good line and length outside off stump, with some swing away from Clarke, who lets it go
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run short of a length wider outside off, Clarke steers off the back foot through point
Steyn to Siddle, 1 run edged but safe, Siddle pushes from the crease at a full ball outside off and gets an edge that falls short of third slip and goes past
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run pushed off the front foot through point once again
Steyn to Siddle, no run good length and straight, defended on the leg side
Steyn to Siddle, FOUR runs too full and a bit too straight, Siddle stays in his crease and clips it wide of the fielder at midwicket

Philander to Clarke, FOUR runs I cannot believe there is no second slip. Clarke pushes from his crease at a good length ball that seams away from him and edges it towards the cordon. Smith dives to his right from first slip but can't reach it properly. that could have gone stra
Philander to Clarke, no run length ball outside off stump, Clarke flashes but makes no contact
Philander to Clarke, no run Clarke prods at one outside off stump and then pulls his bat inside the line to let it go
Philander to Clarke, 1 run nudged off the pads behind square for a single
Philander to Siddle, no run good length outside off, Siddle calmly lets it go
Philander to Siddle, no run good length outside off with seam movement away from Siddle who pulls his bat out of the line of the ball
Steyn to Clarke, no run Steyn gets the outswinger to bounce and move significantly away from Clarke, who fends and has no chance at making any contact
Steyn to Clarke, 2 runs Clarke strides forward and drives through point, a misfield from Prince in the deep allows the second, which South Africa will cringe at because Siddle is not on strike
Steyn to Clarke, no run Clarke moves forward and drives a perfect outswinger to mid-off
Steyn to Clarke, no run shorter length outside off stump, Clarke watches it swing past him to Boucher
Steyn to Clarke, 2 runs short ball and Clarke plays a short arm pull from outside off through midwicket
Steyn to Clarke, FOUR runs full ball and Clarke meets it on the front foot and drives to the long-on boundary, terrific stroke
Philander to Siddle, no run defended on the back foot on the off side
Philander to Siddle, no run a bouncer, and Siddle ducks to safely let it pass
Philander to Siddle, no run full ball outside off and the outswing beats Siddle's drive
Philander to Siddle, no run the length is shorter and the line is at the batsman, Siddle gets behind the ball and blocks on the off side
Philander to Siddle, no run Philander gets this one to seam into the right-hander from a good length outside off, Siddle moves forward to play but gets beaten between bat and pad
Philander to Siddle, no run Siddle's survived the entire over, he defended the last ball competently on the off side
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run a bit too much width outside off and Clarke cuts off the back foot to deep point, Siddle now has five to face
Steyn to Siddle, no run Steyn pitches the outswinger on a good length in line with middle stump, Siddle squares up to defend but the ball screams past his outside edge
Steyn to Siddle, no run terrific outswing bowling, Siddle tries to drive but is no where near it, swings from in line with the stumps past the outside edge

Steyn to Siddle, 2 runs dropped! Siddle tries to push the outswinger through midwicket and he gets a leading edge. The ball flew at comfortable pace and height to point where Tahir dropped it. de Villiers isn't at point, maybe because of his hand? That ball went through Tahir's
Steyn to Siddle, no run defended on the back foot
Steyn to Siddle, no run shorter length, Siddle defends on the back foot
Philander to Clarke, no run good length outside off stump, no seam or swing on that one, Clarke watches it closely and shoulders arms
Philander to Clarke, no run short of a length with some seam movement away from Clarke who lets it go again
Philander to Clarke, no run Clarke pushes from his crease at one that seams away from a good length on off stump and gets beaten
Philander to Clarke, no run Philander is bowling around 130kph and gets past Clarke's outside edge again, beating the batsman with away movement
Philander to Clarke, 1 run the edge doesn't carry! Clarke edges one that pitches on a length and seams away, Kallis dives to his right from second slip but the ball falls short
Philander to Siddle, no run Siddle tries to let the ball go but the line is straight and he wears the ball on the thigh, it goes to fine leg but they can't run for that
Steyn to Clarke, no run Steyn pitches the outswinger around off, Clarke strides forward and shoulders arms
Steyn to Clarke, no run this time it's the one that swings in from a full length, he can do that too! Clarke meets it on the front foot and plays on the off side
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run short of a length at Clarke's body, he takes one leg off the ground as he plays a short-arm pull to deep square
Steyn to Siddle, no run too wide outside off, Siddle lets it go
Steyn to Siddle, no run that wasn't the outswinger, it was the one that angled into the right-hander, Siddle let it go and was lucky his off stump wasn't uprooted
Steyn to Siddle, no run Siddle presses forward and defends a full outswinger towards cover point
Philander to Clarke, 1 run short of a length at the body, Clarke tucks it around the corner and runs
Philander to Siddle, no run a bouncer, and Siddle gets under it
Philander to Siddle, no run played towards backward point
Philander to Siddle, no run Philander swings the ball into Siddle who moves forward and gets a thick inside edge towards the leg side
Philander to Siddle, no run a well directed bouncer, Siddle begins to duck but then also turns his head away from the line of the ball to let it pass
Philander to Siddle, no run short of a length outside off, cut off the back foot to Amla at point, that was 130kph as well
Steyn to Clarke, no run good length and straight, defended on the back foot
Steyn to Clarke, no run 135 kph, short of a length and straight, Clarke plays off the back foot towards mid-on
Steyn to Clarke, no run full ball outside off, Clarke leans forward and plays a punchy cover drive that is stopped in the in field
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run that's a slightly slower short ball, Clarke was early on the swivel pull and waited a touch before hitting it to deep square leg
Steyn to Siddle, 2 runs too straight and Siddle nudges the ball off the pads towards long leg, Philander runs to his left from fine leg but can't prevent the second
Steyn to Siddle, no run played off the back foot towards gully
Philander to Clarke, no run defended on the front foot on the on side
Philander to Clarke, 1 run played off the back foot through midwicket
Philander to Siddle, no run good length and very straight, Siddle gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat
Philander to Siddle, 1 run full ball on off stump at 130 kph, Siddle moves forward and pushes the ball into a gap at cover
Philander to Clarke, no run good length on off stump, Clarke defends from his crease
Philander to Clarke, no run short of a length outside off stump, Clarke cuts but can't beat point, I think I heard him groan
Steyn to Siddle, no run good length on off stump at 138kph, Siddle gets behind the line and blocks on the off side
Steyn to Siddle, no run Steyn bangs in the bouncer at 138kph, Siddle ducks and lets it go relatively easily
Steyn to Siddle, no run full and straight, Siddle stayed in his crease and pushed it towards point

Steyn to Siddle, no run Steyn might be fuming here, these deliveries are too good for No. 9. This one pitched in line with the stumps and swung away sharply from a good length, Siddle pushed forward but was miles from the ball
Steyn to Siddle, no run left alone outside off stump, another outswinger
Steyn to Siddle, 2 runs Steyn slants the last delivery into Siddle who moves forward and manages to play the ball through square leg
Morkel to Clarke, no run full length and straight, Clarke gets behind the line and blocks
Morkel to Clarke, no run full ball just outside off, Clarke strides forward and shoulders arms
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run good length and straight once again, Clarke stays in his crease and opens the face to play the ball towards cover
Morkel to Siddle, 1 run Morkel angles a length ball into Siddle, who works it off his hips through square
Morkel to Clarke, (no ball) that is a screamer at 141.5 kph, the ball rose sharply off a good length and roared past Clarke's attempt at defending off the back foot, tight no-ball call
Morkel to Clarke, 2 runs fuller length on the pads, Clarke clips through square
Morkel to Clarke, FOUR runs edged and four! Clarke tries to cut one that pitches on a good length and jags back at him, the bottom edge misses the stumps and goes wide of Boucher
Tahir to Siddle, no run defended on the front foot
Tahir to Siddle, 4 leg byes that's a flat ball outside leg, the attempted googly, it clips Siddle's pads and goes past Boucher
Tahir to Siddle, no run full ball on off stump, Siddle drives to cover point
Tahir to Siddle, 2 runs Siddle tries to defend on the front foot but gets an inside edge on the leg side
Tahir to Siddle, no run defended on the front foot
Tahir to Siddle, no run tossed up on middle stump, Siddle pushes forward and defends
Morkel to Clarke, no run full ball just outside off stump, Clarke stays in his crease and drives to mid-off
Morkel to Clarke, no run good length and straight, Clarke moves back and across to defend. Morkel gets such awesome bounce from a good length

Morkel to Clarke, no run how do you play that? The ball pitches on a good length, bounces sharply and seams just a touch away from Clarke, who moves forward to block but is beaten. A near-perfect delivery, only the edge was missing
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run played through square leg
Morkel to Siddle, no run the bouncer at 142kph, Siddle ducks
Morkel to Siddle, no run beaten again, the batsman pushed at a full ball outside off
Tahir to Clarke, no run tossed up but a bit too wide outside off, Clarke lets it go
Tahir to Clarke, no run flighted delivery on a straighter line, Clarke blocks on the front foot
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run Clarke skips down the pitch to take the ball on the full and plays to long-on
Tahir to Siddle, 1 run Siddle gets down low and sweeps from in line of the stumps behind square
Tahir to Clarke, no run bowled quick through the air on middle stump, defended on the front foot
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run shorter length, Clarke moves back and clips the ball off his pads through square
Morkel to Clarke, no run good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
Morkel to Clarke, no run full and straight, Clarke plays it back to the bowler
Morkel to Clarke, no run good length just outside off, Clarke shoulders arms
Morkel to Clarke, no run short of a length and right at the batsman, defended off the back foot on the off side
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run good length ball on off and middle, Clarke plays it close on the leg side and the batsmen sprint the single
Morkel to Siddle, no run Morkel fires in a full ball around off, Siddle moves forward and defends
Tahir to Clarke, no run full ball driven firmly back to the bowler. Tahir fields, twirls around and threatens to throw at the batsman
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run driven along the ground to long-off
Tahir to Siddle, no run defended on the front foot
Tahir to Siddle, no run full toss, driven to AB at cover
Tahir to Siddle, no run left alone outside off stump, and that is drinks
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run full ball around off stump, played from the crease on the off side
Morkel to Siddle, FOUR runs short of a length just outside off and Siddle cracks the ball between gully and third slip by opening the face
Morkel to Siddle, no run short ball, which Siddle avoids

Morkel to Siddle, OUT caught at short cover! Morkel hits a good length once again and slants the ball into Siddle, who plays a loose drive. The ball lobs towards cover where AB takes a comfortable catch. Siddle's played his part, though, in a partnership of 59
Morkel to Lyon, no run the ball springs off a good length and seams away to beat Lyon's defence
Morkel to Lyon, no run too wide outside off, Lyon puts in an exaggerated stride and shoulders arms
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run driven off the front foot towards cover
Tahir to Lyon, no run defended on the front foot to the bowler
Tahir to Lyon, 1 run full toss swept off the front foot behind square
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run Clarke makes a bit of room and then pushes a quick ball towards cover
Tahir to Lyon, no run bowled slowly on off stump, the ball turns away from Lyon, who shoulders arms
Tahir to Lyon, no run cut off the back foot to point
Morkel to Clarke, FOUR runs shot! Length ball on a straight line, Clarke simply lined it up and lofted through the line, hitting it over mid-on to the boundary
Morkel to Clarke, no run short of a length just outside off, Clarke pushes to a deep point and refuses the single
Morkel to Clarke, FOUR runs full ball on off and middle stump, Clarke gets to 150 by making some room and drilling the ball hard past the bowler
Morkel to Clarke, no run Morkel homes in on middle stump, Clarke stays in his crease and defends on the off side

Morkel to Clarke, no run Morkel bowls that unplayable ball again, one that seams away from the right-hander after bouncing sharply off a good length, Clarke pushed forward to play on the off side but was beaten

Morkel to Clarke, OUT Clarke's terrific innings ends with his leg stump being detonated from the ground. He made room to a good length ball and tried to heave on the leg side, he missed and Morkel was on target
"Only two batsmen in test history have scored two 151s...Clarke & Steve Waugh. Nice company to keep. Useless stat, but I like the symmetry," says Smudgeon.

11.25 Australia added 70 runs this morning for the loss of Siddle and Clarke. They will take that, gladly. 284 is a rather decent total. The ball is still doing a lot on this pitch. We'll see how potent the Australians are in about ten minutes.
Ryan Harris to open the bowling, from over the wicket. Three slips and short leg in place.

The Australians are jogging out on to Newlands after a huddle. Graeme Smith and Jacques Rudolph walk down the stairs from the dressing room. The tables have been turned now. How will the hosts' batsmen cope against Johnson, Harris and Siddle?
Harris to Rudolph, no run good length and straight, the batsman gets behind the line and defends
Harris to Rudolph, 2 runs 140.2 kph on off stump, Rudolph pushes forward at a good length delivery and gets an inside edge towards deep square
Harris to Rudolph, no run short of a length outside off, slanting away from the left-hander who lets it go
Harris to Rudolph, no run Rudolph once again shouders arms as Harris pitches on a good length and slants across him
Harris to Rudolph, no run fuller and straighter, Rudolph has to play, he stays in his crease and pushes towards cover
Harris to Rudolph, 1 run good length on off stump, Rudolph pushes with soft hands into the gap at extra cover and runs the single before mid-off can reach the ball
Johnson to Rudolph, no run defended on the back foot on the off side
Johnson to Rudolph, no run 142.4 kph on a great length just outside off, Rudolph covered his off stump, began to play at it and then let it go, didn't look very comfortable
Johnson to Rudolph, no run full and straight at 140 kph, Rudolph plays back to the bowler
Johnson to Rudolph, FOUR runs Rudolph moved so far across his stumps that I got a peek at leg stump. He then flicked a full ball from off and middle past the fielder at short leg, uppish but safe
Johnson to Rudolph, no run he tries to flick once again after moving across but can't make contact, Haddin appeals for a catch down the leg side but it came off the pad, Johnson did not bother
Johnson to Rudolph, no run good length outside off, left alone by the batsman
Harris to Smith, no run too wide outside off, Smith can let his first ball go rather easily
Harris to Smith, no run short ball just outside off, Smith sinks to his knees to let it pass
Harris to Smith, no run short of a length outside off, left alone once again
Harris to Smith, no run fuller length but the angle across the left-hander from over the wicket makes the line too wide for Smith to want to play a shot
Harris to Smith, no run defended from the crease towards point
Harris to Smith, no run fuller length and a straight line, Smith moves forward and defends with bat and pad close together
Johnson to Rudolph, 2 runs too full on the pads, Rudolph clips towards long leg where Harris runs to his right and saves the boundary
Johnson to Rudolph, no run better line on off and middle, defended back to the bowler
Johnson to Rudolph, 2 runs Johnson fires the ball in towards middle at 143 kph, Rudolph stays in his crease, moves a little across and plays wide of mid-on
Johnson to Rudolph, 2 runs he hasn't timed the drive too well but placed it between extra cover and mid-off, the line and length was full outside off
Johnson to Rudolph, 1 wide the bouncer sails over the batsman's head and Haddin has to jump to collect it
Johnson to Rudolph, no run good length on off stump at 141 kph, Rudolph gets behind the line and defends towards the bowler

Johnson to Rudolph, 3 runs short of a length with width outside off, Rudolph stays in his crease and slaps the ball through cover, he hasn't timed it perfectly so the ball won't beat the fielder's chase
Harris to Rudolph, no run left alone outside off stump
Harris to Rudolph, no run full length but the line is outside off, allowing Rudolph to shoulder arms
Harris to Rudolph, no run 140.7 kph, similar ball, full but outside off, Rudolph strides forward and lets it go
Harris to Rudolph, 2 runs straighter line, Rudoplh plays the ball off his pads in front of square
Harris to Rudolph, no run good length but the line is outside leg, Rudolph tries to glance but misses and gets hit on the pad
Harris to Rudolph, no run good length on middle stump, Rudolph stays in his crease and defends
Siddle to Smith, 2 runs Smith gets off the mark by closing the face and forcing the ball off middle behind square
Siddle to Smith, (no ball) Siddle oversteps and bowls a stunning ball, bouncing sharply off a good length and seaming across Smith, who was squared up and beaten
Siddle to Smith, 2 runs Smith gets squared up once again but plays the short of a length delivery between gully and point
Siddle to Smith, no run full and straight, Smith thumps the ball to mid-on
Siddle to Smith, no run good length but the line is too wide, Smith strides forward and lets the ball go
Siddle to Smith, no run good length outside off, another one for Haddin to take
Siddle to Smith, no run good length around middle stump, Smith moves back and across and closes the face to play on the leg side, he gets a bit of a leading edge that falls on the pitch
Harris to Rudolph, no run short of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
Harris to Rudolph, no run full length close to off, the batsman lets the ball pass
Harris to Rudolph, no run Rudolph rubs the inside of his thigh after getting an inside edge on to his body
Harris to Rudolph, no run pitches on a good length and slants across Rudolph who lifts his bat out of the way

Harris to Rudolph, OUT cleaned him up! Harris goes straight through Rudolph's defence and uproots off stump. The ball pitched on a good length and bent back in ever so slightly after angling across the left-hander. Rudolph played outside the line from his crease and was beaten b
Harris to Amla, no run Amla stays in his crease and plays a length ball on the off side
Siddle to Smith, no run full length just outside off, Smith moves forward and plays with a straight bat
Siddle to Smith, no run Siddle hits the middle of the pitch to deliver a bouncer, which Smith ducks under
Siddle to Smith, no run the ball rears up off a good length and smacks Smith on the glove of the bottom hand as he tries to defend
Siddle to Smith, 2 runs Smith drives a full ball back at the bowler and Siddle deflects it close to the stumps at the non-striker's end, Amla was way out of his crease
Siddle to Smith, no run another bouncer, which the batsman lets go
Siddle to Smith, 2 runs full ball outside off, Smith leans forward and drives towards cover
Harris to Amla, no run good length just outside off, Amla stays on the back foot and defends on the off side
Harris to Amla, 2 runs nice ball to get when you haven't scored, on the pads and Amla tucks it around the corner
Harris to Amla, no run good length outside off at 141.5 kph, Amla shoulders arms
Harris to Amla, no run fuller length but the line is outside off so Amla can let the ball go again
Harris to Amla, 4 leg byes full ball down leg side, Amla misses the glance but gets some pad on it which takes it past Haddin
Harris to Amla, no run defended back to the bowler
Siddle to Smith, FOUR runs edged between third slip and gully, the ball didn't carry either. Siddle slanted the ball across Smith, who had a little poke
Siddle to Smith, 2 runs full ball outside off, Smith pushes through cover on the front foot
Siddle to Smith, no run Siddle pitches on a good length in line with the stumps, making Smith defend, and then seams the ball across the outside edge
Siddle to Smith, no run defended on the back foot back to the bowler
Siddle to Smith, 1 run short of a length at the body, Smith moves back and works the ball behind square
Siddle to Amla, no run short of a length outside off, left alone by the batsman
Johnson to Smith, no run good length outside off, Smith defends from the crease back to the bowler
Johnson to Smith, no run defended on the back foot towards the bowler
Johnson to Smith, FOUR runs short ball, and it sits up for Smith who moves quickly and pulls the ball with muscle to the midwicket boundary
Johnson to Smith, 1 run good length outside off, Smith pushes from the crease in front of point and thunders down the pitch for a quick single
Johnson to Amla, no run full ball very wide outside off, Amla lets it go
Johnson to Amla, no run full ball outside off stump, left alone by Amla
Siddle to Smith, no run full length outside off, defended back to the bowler
Siddle to Smith, no run defended on the front foot towards the leg side
Siddle to Smith, no run good length just outside off, Smith shoulders arms
Siddle to Smith, no run played back to the bowler and Smith takes a few quick steps towards the off side in case Siddle has a shy
Siddle to Smith, no run full length around off, defended back to the bowler
Siddle to Smith, no run Smith gets squared up and beaten by one that pitches on a good length in line with the stumps and seams across him
Johnson to Amla, no run wide outside off stump, Amla lets it go
Johnson to Amla, no run Johnson sprays it wide outside off from over the wicket, Amla barely budges
Johnson to Amla, no run straighter line, and Amla defends from his crease towards the bowler
Johnson to Amla, 1 run short of a length on off stump, Amla jumps back and punches through cover, the fielder dives to his right and gets a hand on the ball

Johnson to Smith, 2 runs quick single after Smith pushes the ball close on the off side, he ran quickly and slid his bat in properly to beat the direct hit, the ball ricochets off the stumps for overthrows
Johnson to Smith, no run good length just outside off at brisk pace, Smith meets it on the front foot and defends solidly, and that will be lunch
Watson to Amla, no run good length and straight, Amla defends from the crease on the leg side

Watson to Amla, OUT Lbw! Watson nips the ball into Amla and hits the pad, loud appeal for lbw follows and the umpire says not out. Clarke asks for a review. The ball pitched just outside off and swung in to hit the pad on the top part of the knee roll. Replays indicate the ball
Watson to Kallis, no run wicket-to-wicket line from Watson, Kallis stays in his crease and defends on the off side
Watson to Kallis, no run Kallis meets a full ball with a firm straight drive, Johnson moves to his right and dives to cut off the boundary
Watson to Kallis, no run good length on off stump, making the batsman play, Kallis defends on the back foot

Watson to Kallis, OUT has Watson got another one? Kallis tries to pull a short ball but doesn't make proper contact, the ball lobs off something and is caught by Ponting second slip. The Australians are convinced it's off the bat. Kallis is not going anywhere and the umpire Ian
Harris to Smith, (no ball) Harris oversteps and bowls a short of a length ball that hits Smith on the thigh as he tries to play through leg. Very harsh call from the umpire
Harris to Smith, 2 runs full ball on the pads, played to fine leg
Harris to Smith, 1 run short of a length, Smith moves back and across to play the ball on the leg side
Harris to de Villiers, no run Harris pitches on a good length outside off and beats AB's defence
Harris to de Villiers, no run Harris hits the glove as AB tries to play on the leg side from the crease
Harris to de Villiers, FOUR runs superb shot, AB moves forward to a full ball and drives through mid-off with outstanding timing
Harris to de Villiers, no run short of a length angling into the right-hander, AB gets an inside edge on to the thigh as he tries to defend
Watson to Smith, no run Watson hits the pad once again after Smith tries to play on the leg side, but that might have pitched outside leg
Watson to Smith, no run good length ball outside off, Smith hangs his bat out as it angles across him and gets beaten
Watson to Smith, no run good length outside off stump, Smith defends on the front foot towards the bowler
Watson to Smith, FOUR runs full ball with some swing into the left-hander, Smith forces the ball from off and middle through midwicket
Watson to Smith, 3 runs wider outside off stump this time, Smith drives the full ball through cover off the front foot
Watson to de Villiers, FOUR runs full toss and AB drives it past mid-on with a straight bat. Two wickets in his previous over, 11 runs off this one.
Harris to Smith, no run good length ball around off stump angling across Smith, who defends
Harris to Smith, 2 runs short of a length delivery on the body, Smith moves back and across and plays the ball off his hips behind square
Harris to Smith, 3 runs driven through cover once again, not enough legs on the ball for it to reach the boundary
Harris to de Villiers, no run full ball around off stump, driven from the crease to mid-off
Harris to de Villiers, no run good length on off and middle, AB gets behind the line and defends on the back foot
Harris to de Villiers, no run good length just outside of, AB moves forward and plays the ball towards gully
Watson to Boucher, no run good length and very straight, Boucher moves forward and across and plays on the leg side, that moved into the right-hander
Watson to Boucher, FOUR runs too full and straight, Boucher moves across and flicks the ball from middle stump through midwicket
Watson to Boucher, no run Boucher defends from the crease on the leg side
Watson to Boucher, no run Watson bowls a full ball that swings into the right-hander, Boucher gets an inside edge on to the pad

Harris to de Villiers, OUT (18.1) Another referral! Looks like an optimistic one, but there's no stopping the Aussies from signalling the 'T' now. Was it pad first? Harris nips one in from a length outside off, as AB pushes forward with bat and pad close together ... I tell you

Harris to Philander, no run Harris puts in a lot of effort, 140 kph on a length and he tumbles on his follow through. Philander defends from the crease to the off side. No referral, in case you were wondering.
Harris to Philander, no run stays on the crease once again, defended to the off side from the crease.
Harris to Philander, no run gets this one to jump up and bounce from a length, at 141 kph, Philander pokes at it from the crease and misses.
Harris to Philander, no run lets this one go through outside off.
Harris to Philander, no run Good length around off stump, defended from the crease towards point
Watson to Boucher, no run full ball from Watson, driven firmly to short mid-on
Watson to Boucher, no run defended on the off side

Watson to Boucher, OUT given lbw! Watson has five, or does he? Boucher's reviewed it this time. That pitched just outside off stump and angled into Boucher, who tries to defend on the back foot. He misses and the ball crashes into the top of his back pad. Watson is dead sure, a
Watson to Steyn, no run full and straight, the batsman defends on the leg side
Watson to Steyn, no run good length on off stump, defended towards mid-on on the front foot
Watson to Steyn, no run played towards mid-on once again
Harris to Philander, no run good length outside off, Philander lets it go
Harris to Philander, no run Harris nips the ball into Philander, who plays from his crease and gets hit on the thigh
Harris to Philander, no run played towards square leg from the crease
Harris to Philander, FOUR runs full ball on middle stump, Philander gets going by clubbing it through midwicket for his first Test runs
Harris to Philander, no run played from the crease towards midwicket, Harris is keeping it full and straight

Harris to Philander, OUT caught at slip! The collapse continues. Philander tries to drive a good length ball on the up without really moving his feet. He gets a thick edge that flies quickly to third slip. Not too quick for Ponting, though, and he takes the catch to the right o
Watson to Steyn, 1 run good length on middle and leg, played off the pads behind square
Watson to Morkel, 1 run short of a length outside off, Morkel stays on the back foot and drives behind point
Watson to Steyn, no run good length and straight, played off the front foot to midwicket

Watson to Steyn, OUT run out! Australia are mauling South Africa. Steyn played the ball on the back foot towards mid-on and set off. Morkel was late in responding and he isn't the quickest between wickets. Siddle sprinted from mid-on, picked up, and scored a direct hit at the s
Watson to Tahir, no run Watson fires it into the blockhole, Tahir defends back to the bowler
Watson to Tahir, no run that was heading straight for off and middle until Tahir brought his bat down very late and played on the off side
Harris to Steyn, 2 runs well they have avoided the follow on. Steyn drives the ball wide of mid-off and runs two
Harris to Steyn, no run Steyn tries to drive again but mis-times it towards mid-on
Harris to Steyn, no run Steyn tries an ambitious drive on the up but makes no contact with a fast one outside off
Harris to Steyn, no run Steyn aims for the sea with a tremendous heave, but makes no contact once again
Harris to Steyn, 1 run played close on the off side and they set off for a risky single, Harris sprints across, fields and throws at the striker's end. That would have been out had he hit
Harris to Tahir, 2 runs full ball outside off stump, driven from the crease through cover point with a thrash of the bat
Johnson to Steyn, no run short of a length and straight, the batsman tries to chip the ball over the cordon but gets beaten
Johnson to Steyn, 2 runs short of a length and Steyn pulls to the fielder in the deep
Johnson to Steyn, no run Steyn swings, swings with the attitude of someone who is batting far earlier than he would have liked. He gets beaten
Johnson to Steyn, no run short of a length delivery, left alone

Johnson to Steyn, 2 runs he's finally made contact! Johnson goes round the wicket and angles the ball into the right-hander. There was a huge sound as Steyn made contact, but he hit the ball high and not far. It falls in the outfield at long-on
Johnson to Steyn, no run full ball fired down leg side
Harris to Tahir, 3 runs full and straight, Tahir plays a nice straight rive that clips the stumps at the bowler's end and deflects past mid-on for runs
Harris to Steyn, 1 run short ball and Steyn pulls towards deep midwicket
Australia lead by 188, Clarke's innings seems priceless now. How can South Africa pick themselves up from here?

2.25 pm Australia have taken nine wickets after lunch for 47 runs. South Africa have been bowled out for their second lowest total since readmission. Watson took five in a blink of an eye, and Harris cleaned up the rest. This is a stunning turnaround. And the ball didn't do much at al
Innings Start
Ryan Harris to open the attack ... three slips and a gully.
